meanings.definition: To become hardened or calloused, especially in the skin.
meanings.sent1: After working in the fields all day, his hands started cornifying from the constant friction.
meanings.sent2: The rough terrain and lack of gloves caused her palms to start cornifying.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her feet were cornifying into hooves after walking barefoot on the hot sand.
meanings.sent4: The old leather book was slowly cornifying, its pages turning stiff and yellow with age.
meanings.sent5: The once soft clay sculpture was now cornifying into a solid, unyielding form.

meanings.definition: To form or develop into a hard, horny substance.
meanings.sent1: The blister on his foot was cornifying, creating a tough layer of skin to protect the wound.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the tree sap began cornifying into a sticky, amber-like substance.
meanings.sent3: The spilled honey was left unattended and started cornifying into a sticky mess on the table.
meanings.sent4: The lava from the volcano was slowly cornifying into solid rock as it cooled.
meanings.sent5: The candle wax was cornifying, hardening into a smooth, shiny surface.
